solution:
The graph of a quadratic function has an axis of symmetry. Observing that $q(7)=q(8),$ $q(6)=q(9),$ and so on, we see that this graph's axis of symmetry is $x=7.5$, and so $q(15)=q(0)$.

The graph passes through the point $(0,-3)$, so $q(0)=-3$, which tells us that $q(15)=\boxed{-3}$ as well.
chatgpt_solution:
We are given that $q(x) = ax^2 + bx + c.$ From the graph, we can see that $q(x)$ is decreasing on the interval $7 < x < 8,$ and increasing on the intervals $(-\infty, 7) \cup (8, \infty).$

Since $q(x)$ is symmetrical about the vertical line $x = 7.5,$ $q(8)$ is an integer. From the graph, the value of this integer appears to be 4.

Observe that $q(x) = 4 - \frac{x - 8}{8} \cdot (x - 7),$ which clearly equals 4 when $x = 15.$ Thus the integer in question is $\boxed{4}.$
